Name: Mexican 55
Ingredients: 15 ml Sugar syrup 'rich' (2 sugar to 1 water, 65.0°Brix)
Top up with Brut champagne/sparkling wine
Instructions: SHAKE first 4 ingredients with ice and strain into ice-filled glass. TOP with champagne.
Review: Suitably hard, yet surprisingly refreshing and sophisticated.
History: An adaptation of the classic French 75 created in 1988 at La Perla, Paris, France. The name is said to come from Fidel Castro's statement, "Bullets come by vintages, like wine, especially Latin American bullets. Mexican '55 is a good year, '52 not so good." More information on the history and variants of the French 75 can be found on our page.
Nutrition: One serving of Mexican 55 contains 152 calories
